definition: to go to sleep/to go to bed (literary)

at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning

sentences.english: He has usually finished all his correspondence before bedtime.
sentences.chinese: 他通常都在就寢前將所有信件處理完畢。

sentences.english: "The bedtime routine is the most important thing to consider when establishing a schedule," says Altmann.
sentences.chinese: 就寢時間是建立規律時首要考慮的事。

sentences.english: Back in her own flat, the teacher of English prepared for bed.
sentences.chinese: 英語教師回到自己的公寓後就準備就寢。

sentences.english: Years later Patterson still has the same bedtime routine.
sentences.chinese: 幾年後，佩特森仍然保持着同樣的就寢時間。

sentences.english: I will not ask my master to retire to his crate anymore.
sentences.chinese: 我不會再要求主人到柳條箱去就寢。

sentences.english: Then stick with the last bedtime.
sentences.chinese: 然後堅持最後一次就寢的時間。

sentences.english: Black bears are now considered highly efficient hibernators.
sentences.chinese: 此刻，人們以爲黑熊是就寢效率最高的蟄伏動物。

sentences.english: The lone night lies along your path, the dawn sleeps behind the shadowy hills.
sentences.chinese: 永夜躺在你的路邊，平明在朦朧的山後就寢。

sentences.english: He filled up the time between supper and bed with watching television.
sentences.chinese: 他在飯後和就寢前的這段時間裏全在看電視。

sentences.english: So factor this into the timing of your bedtime routine.
sentences.chinese: 誠然，這是影響你日常的就寢時間的因素。

sentences.english: Comment: such guests, wherever they sleep, always they keep light turning on.
sentences.chinese: 主要是女性客人，這類人一身在無論何處就寢都這樣。

sentences.english: She fed him again at suppertime , and again just before going to bed.
sentences.chinese: 晚飯時她還要一遍遍地喂他，直到上牀就寢前爲止。

sentences.english: I went to bed late last night and missed my beauty sleep.
sentences.chinese: 昨夜我很晚才就寢，錯過了上半夜的睡眠。
就寢時間到了還沒有回來。
他的就寢時間是八點鐘。

sentences.english: Take a nap or go to bed earlier instead.
sentences.chinese: 小睡一會或者晚上早些就寢。

definition: to rouse/to be woken by sth/to wake with a start/to sleep lightly
matins/morning service (in the Catholic Church)/morning chorus (of birds)
to close a door/to lock a door/(of a shop etc) to close (for the night, or permanently)
11 pm-1 am (in the system of two-hour subdivisions used in former times)
to have a lie-in/to dawdle in bed
